title: How to use non-verbal communication and symbolism in therapy: Understanding archetypes and false symbolism, using techniques such as hypnodrama and magnetic passes, and learning to read clientsâ€™ reactions. Exploring different levels of moving therapy and somnambulism.
first_phrase: This text explores the world of nonverbal communication in hypnotherapy. The first part defines true and false symbolism and describes how identifying a symbol with just one side of the individual can cause a psychological charge. The text then moves on to nonverbal hypnosis and introduces techniques like magnetic passes, touch, and sound to induce a hypnotic state. The text also discusses closure of senses, 10 plexuses technique, and the twelve passes to equalize the magnetic force. The exercises provided include testing balance and doing hypnodrama, while the text also offers a method to heal spine pains and sciatica.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the techniques and exercises discussed in the past few days of therapy can be powerful tools for helping clients work through their issues and achieve their desired goals. From increasing archetypes to using the sway test and magnetic passes, these methods can lead to deep trance and even past life regression. By incorporating non-verbal communication and breathing techniques, somnambulism, and working with muscular and magnetic preferences, therapists can help clients overcome a wide range of issues.
